Half Life 2 decided to go into a Episodic format...
It did not work at all. 
(This is not hate toward VALVe, this is my honest opinion.)

Story : The Story picks up after Episode 1, following Gordon and Alyx again as they have to destroy a portal caused by the destruction of the Citadel, working alongside the rebels in the outlaws of City17. 

It's VERY short, lasting 4 hours if you go straight forward. If you don't know already, which is hard because it's been a meme for 10 years, it leaves on a Cliffhanger for Episode 3 which will never be a thing except through Marc Laidlaw's summery he placed online. To be honest, I liked the narrative, but it concludes to something that is not worth it. - 5/10. Only props for trying to make it interesting. 

Gameplay: The gameplay is great, simular to Half Life 2, actually recycled, but not terrible. Nothing really new except the theme, new enemies and missions. Although it's pretty fun nontheless. - 8/10.

Graphics : The Graphics are nice. The updated engine makes up for it. It looks nice with the new visuals and Cutscenes, being pretty sweet. Especially the D0G vs Strider fight. - 9/10. 

Optimization - Runs very well. I don't know what to say. - 10/10. 


Final verdict : 7/10
Episode 2 really delivers, but is disappointing in the process. I only recommend it if you want a continuation of the story but your going to feel left down by it's length, along with all of it not being worth it in the end, but surprised by how well it holds up gameplay wise. Everything else about it is great though, my main criticism is how the game leads up to disappointment.
They're probably still trying to find out what comes after two... Just call it Episode Finale! Final Episode! I DON'T CARE!

The continuation of Half-Life 2 Ep1. Liked the story?? Then you must play this too.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] Flashlight indicator position is better than the original
[*] New enemies, both extremely high damage and hard to kill
[*] Nice underground tunnels, I liked the theme
[*] Mostly alien fighting, combine fighting is very minimal
[*] The wave defense you must go thru is awesome due to reload downtimes
[*] Alyx blocking you is reduced this time around, always good
[*] Has a nice car thru much of the game, fun to drive and fun situations
[*] The final battle will push you to the maximum, very hard!
[*] Continuation of the story of Half-Life!
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] Compared to Half-Life 2, it's extremely short, finished in 6.5h vs the 14h for Half-Life 2!
[*] The last battle can be frustratingly hard and using your car is not so easy as it seems
[*] We had a freaking cliffhanger for THIRTEEN YEARS now! HL:Alyx helps a little..
[/list]

Obviously, if you are Half-Life 2 Episode 1 deep into the story, the next logical step is playing the Episode 2. If you are here just for a shooter, it's also good, but rather short compared to the previous HL1, HL Opposing Force and HL2. Still recommended cause it's the story progresses and is still as good as the predecessor. But be prepared to join the club of those waiting for the mythical Half-Life 3...

Half Life 2 Episode 2.... did you like the story, and gameplay to Half Life 2, and  Episode 1, you will like the story to episode 2. If you did you will like this. It is a continuation to the epic story from Half Life 2, and Half Life 2 Episode 1.

Pros.
-Great graphics considering its age (over 10 years old)
-runs great even on low end machines.
-epic story
-good weapon selection
-good AI

cons:
my main gripes about Episode 2 is the same as Episode 1, do not take this as a do not buy this however. I bought this game again even though I own it already on XBox 360 and played through it again here. I love this game :).

-In Episode 1 and Episode 2 there are no new weapons.
-In episode 1 and Episode 2 the story length feels short (the episodes are however cheaper than the base game)
-No full controller support (This game does not work witha controller like with the 360.) It is not a big deal, but to say partial controller support is spinning the truth. You cannot celect all of your weapons with a controller. This seems like something that could have been fixed with a patch.

All said and done I did play this with a keyboard and mouse. IT was a blast, and the computer version was converted to use a controller (even if with poor support,) so playing with a keyboard and mouse like old school games is no big deal. If you do not already own this game BUY IT, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
